filmography.title: Golden Boy
filmography.role_description: A talented young violinist who is torn between a musical career and the brutal, lucrative world of professional boxing.
filmography.plot: Against his father's wishes, a young man decides to become a boxer rather than a violinist to make money quickly.

filmography.title: Our Town
filmography.role_description: A kind, small-town boy who grows up, falls in love with his neighbor Emily, and faces the cycles of life and death.
filmography.plot: The story of the residents of a small New England town at the turn of the 20th century, focusing on the romance between George and Emily.

filmography.title: I Wanted Wings
filmography.role_description: A mechanic who enlists in the Army Air Corps to become a pilot, proving his skill and bravery despite his working-class background.
filmography.plot: Three young men from different backgrounds join the United States Army Air Corps in the days before World War II.

filmography.title: Rachel and the Stranger
filmography.role_description: A widowed frontier farmer who treats his indentured servant wife poorly until a charming wanderer visits and sparks his jealousy.
filmography.plot: A man treats his bondswoman wife like a servant until a smooth-talking hunter arrives and shows an interest in her.

filmography.title: Sunset Boulevard
filmography.role_description: A struggling screenwriter who becomes the kept man of a faded silent film star, narrating his own tragic demise.
filmography.plot: A screenwriter develops a dangerous relationship with a faded film star determined to make a triumphant return.

filmography.title: Union Station
filmography.role_description: A tough railway police lieutenant who races against time to catch kidnappers hiding within a busy Chicago train station.
filmography.plot: The police track down a gang who have kidnapped a blind girl and are holding her for ransom in a train station.

filmography.title: Born Yesterday
filmography.role_description: An intelligent journalist hired to educate a corrupt tycoon's unrefined girlfriend, teaching her to think for herself.
filmography.plot: A tycoon hires a tutor to teach his lover proper etiquette, but she learns more than he bargained for.

filmography.title: Stalag 17
filmography.role_description: A cynical, enterprising POW in a German camp who is suspected of being a snitch by his fellow prisoners due to his black market dealings.
filmography.plot: When two escaping American World War II prisoners are killed, the German camp commander discovers it, and a sergeant is suspected of being an informer.

filmography.title: The Moon Is Blue
filmography.role_description: An architect who invites a young actress to his apartment, engaging in a scandalous-for-its-time conversation about morality and seduction.
filmography.plot: A young woman meets an architect on the observation deck of the Empire State Building and accepts an invitation to his apartment.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Musical/Comedy) (David Niven)

filmography.title: Escape from Fort Bravo
filmography.role_description: A harsh Union captain running a Confederate prisoner camp in Arizona who must join forces with his prisoners to fight attacking Mescalero Apaches.
filmography.plot: During the Civil War, the commanding officer of a Union prison camp faces a mass escape and an Indian attack.

filmography.title: Executive Suite
filmography.role_description: An idealistic design engineer who delivers an impassioned speech to the board of directors to save a company's integrity.
filmography.plot: When a powerful CEO dies suddenly, a boardroom power struggle erupts to determine his successor.

filmography.title: Sabrina
filmography.role_description: A carefree, thrice-married playboy whose romance with the chauffeur's daughter threatens a family business merger.
filmography.plot: A playboy becomes interested in the daughter of his family's chauffeur, but it's his more serious brother who would be the better man for her.

filmography.title: The Country Girl
filmography.role_description: A determined theater director who tries to revitalize the career of an alcoholic actor, clashing with the actor's long-suffering wife.
filmography.plot: A director hires an alcoholic actor for a new musical, but the actor's wife becomes the target of the director's suspicion and eventual affection.

filmography.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
filmography.role_description: A weary naval reservist lawyer recalled to fly dangerous bombing missions in the Korean War, struggling with his duty and fear.
filmography.plot: A Navy pilot redeploys to fight in the Korean War and must bomb a set of highly defended bridges.

filmography.title: Love Is a Many-Splendored Thing
filmography.role_description: An American war correspondent in Hong Kong who falls deeply in love with a Eurasian doctor despite cultural prejudices.
filmography.plot: A widowed doctor of both Chinese and European descent falls in love with a married American correspondent in Hong Kong during China's Civil War.

filmography.title: Picnic
filmography.role_description: A handsome drifter who arrives in a small Kansas town on Labor Day, disrupting the lives of the locals with his raw magnetism.
filmography.plot: A drifter arrives in a small Kansas town and complicates the lives of his former college friend and the women in the town.

filmography.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
filmography.role_description: A cynical American sailor who escapes a Japanese POW camp only to be coerced into leading a commando team back to destroy the bridge.
filmography.plot: British POWs are forced to build a railway bridge across the river Kwai for their Japanese captors, not knowing that the allied forces are planning to destroy it.

filmography.title: The Key
filmography.role_description: A tugboat captain in WWII who is given a key to a flat occupied by a woman who has lost a succession of lovers to the war.
filmography.plot: During World War II, a series of tugboat captains share an apartment and the love of a grieving woman who lives there.

filmography.title: The Horse Soldiers
filmography.role_description: A compassionate Union regimental surgeon who constantly clashes with his commander, John Wayne, over the ethics of war.
filmography.plot: A Union Cavalry outfit is sent behind Confederate lines to destroy a railroad supply depot.

filmography.title: The World of Suzie Wong
filmography.role_description: An American architect turned artist in Hong Kong who falls in love with a beautiful Chinese prostitute.
filmography.plot: An American artist in Hong Kong falls in love with a prostitute, but their relationship is tested by cultural differences.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress (Nancy Kwan)

filmography.title: Paris When It Sizzles
filmography.role_description: A heavy-drinking screenwriter who has two days to finish a script and hires a secretary to act out his wild ideas.
filmography.plot: A screenwriter with writer's block hires a secretary to help him finish his script, and they act out the possible scenarios.

filmography.title: The Wild Bunch
filmography.role_description: An aging outlaw leader looking for one last score in a changing West, embodying the end of an era with weary violence.
filmography.plot: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West disappears around them.

filmography.title: Breezy
filmography.role_description: A divorced, middle-aged real estate agent who finds his cynical view of life challenged by a free-spirited young hippie.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged man falls in love with a much younger, free-spirited woman.

filmography.title: The Towering Inferno
filmography.role_description: The builder of a colossal skyscraper who cut corners on safety, leading to a catastrophic fire during the opening party.
filmography.plot: At the opening party of a colossal, but poorly constructed, office building, a massive fire breaks out, threatening to destroy the tower and everyone in it.

filmography.title: Network
filmography.role_description: A veteran news division president who tries to maintain journalistic integrity amidst the sensationalism of modern television.
filmography.plot: A television network cynically exploits a deranged former anchor's ravings and revelations about the news media for its own profit.

filmography.title: Fedora
filmography.role_description: A down-on-his-luck producer who travels to Corfu to persuade a reclusive, legendary actress to come out of retirement.
filmography.plot: A washed-up Hollywood producer attempts to lure a reclusive screen legend out of retirement, only to discover a tragic secret.

filmography.title: S.O.B.
filmography.role_description: A loyal film director friend who helps a producer hatch a wild scheme to turn a family flop into an erotic hit; Holden's final film.
filmography.plot: A movie producer tries to salvage his latest bomb by turning it into a pornographic film.
